intro: Spicantopsis niponica var. minima, commonly known as the Japanese spicantopsis, is a small, herbaceous plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Due to its delicate appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
